summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 among FBI and SDNY personnel scheduling a meeting to discuss an 'Epstein update.' It shows coordination between the FBI's New York office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: SSA - FBI New York
persons.context: The sender/forwarder of the main email, coordinating meeting availability for an Epstein update discussion with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Initiated the meeting request for a 'general team meeting' to have an 'overall discussion and update' on the Epstein case, coordinating schedules with the FBI.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Coordinating to schedule a joint meeting between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office for an update on the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Epstein Update Meeting
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Wednesday at 1:00 p.m. between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office to discuss updates on the Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The email chain is dated January 2020, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to the case.
The correspondence shows coordination between the FBI's New York field office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The purpose of the meeting was for a 'general team meeting' and 'overall discussion and update' on the Epstein matter.
Multiple email addresses and names are redacted in the chain, indicated by placeholders like 'â€¢' and blank 'From:' fields.
The scheduling involved accommodating 'operations' on certain days, suggesting active investigative work was ongoing.
